verses.verse: And there shall come forth <WH3318> a rod <WH2415> out of the stem <WH1503> of Jesse <WH3448>, and a Branch <WH5342> shall grow <WH6509> out of his roots <WH8328>:

And the spirit <WH7307> of the LORD <WH3068> shall rest <WH5117> upon him, the spirit <WH7307> of wisdom <WH2451> and understanding <WH998>, the spirit <WH7307> of counsel <WH6098> and might <WH1369>, the spirit <WH7307> of knowledge <WH1847> and of the fear <WH3374> of the LORD <WH3068>;

And shall make him of quick understanding <WH7306> in the fear <WH3374> of the LORD <WH3068>: and he shall not judge <WH8199> after the sight <WH4758> of his eyes <WH5869>, neither reprove <WH3198> after the hearing <WH4926> of his ears <WH241>: quick: Heb. scent or, smell

But with righteousness <WH6664> shall he judge <WH8199> the poor <WH1800>, and reprove <WH3198> with equity <WH4334> for the meek <WH6035> of the earth <WH776>: and he shall smite <WH5221> the earth <WH776> with the rod <WH7626> of his mouth <WH6310>, and with the breath <WH7307> of his lips <WH8193> shall he slay <WH4191> the wicked <WH7563>. reprove: or, argue
And righteousness <WH6664> shall be the girdle <WH232> of his loins <WH4975>, and faithfulness <WH530> the girdle <WH232> of his reins <WH2504>.

The wolf <WH2061> also shall dwell <WH1481> with the lamb <WH3532>, and the leopard <WH5246> shall lie down <WH7257> with the kid <WH1423>; and the calf <WH5695> and the young lion <WH3715> and the fatling <WH4806> together <WH3162>; and a little <WH6996> child <WH5288> shall lead <WH5090> them.

And the cow <WH6510> and the bear <WH1677> shall feed <WH7462>; their young ones <WH3206> shall lie down <WH7257> together <WH3162>: and the lion <WH738> shall eat <WH398> straw <WH8401> like the ox <WH1241>.

And the sucking child <WH3243> shall play <WH8173> on the hole <WH2352> of the asp <WH6620>, and the weaned child <WH1580> shall put <WH1911> his hand <WH3027> on the cockatrice' <WH6848> den <WH3975>. cockatrice: or, adders

They shall not hurt <WH7489> nor destroy <WH7843> in all my holy <WH6944> mountain <WH2022>: for the earth <WH776> shall be full <WH4390> of the knowledge <WH1844> of the LORD <WH3068>, as the waters <WH4325> cover <WH3680> the sea <WH3220>.

And in that day <WH3117> there shall be a root <WH8328> of Jesse <WH3448>, which shall stand <WH5975> for an ensign <WH5251> of the people <WH5971>; to it shall the Gentiles <WH1471> seek <WH1875>: and his rest <WH4496> shall be glorious <WH3519>. glorious: Heb. glory

And it shall come to pass in that day <WH3117>, that the Lord <WH136> shall set <WH3254> his hand <WH3027> again <WH3254> the second time <WH8145> to recover <WH7069> the remnant <WH7605> of his people <WH5971>, which shall be left <WH7604>, from Assyria <WH804>, and from Egypt <WH4714>, and from Pathros <WH6624>, and from Cush <WH3568>, and from Elam <WH5867>, and from Shinar <WH8152>, and from Hamath <WH2574>, and from the islands <WH339> of the sea <WH3220>.

And he shall set up <WH5375> an ensign <WH5251> for the nations <WH1471>, and shall assemble <WH622> the outcasts <WH1760> of Israel <WH3478>, and gather together <WH6908> the dispersed <WH5310> of Judah <WH3063> from the four <WH702> corners <WH3671> of the earth <WH776>. corners: Heb. wings

The envy <WH7068> also of Ephraim <WH669> shall depart <WH5493>, and the adversaries <WH6887> of Judah <WH3063> shall be cut off <WH3772>: Ephraim <WH669> shall not envy <WH7065> Judah <WH3063>, and Judah <WH3063> shall not vex <WH6887> Ephraim <WH669>.

But they shall fly <WH5774> upon the shoulders <WH3802> of the Philistines <WH6430> toward the west <WH3220>; they shall spoil <WH962> them <WH1121> of the east <WH6924> together <WH3162>: they shall lay <WH4916> their hand <WH3027> upon Edom <WH123> and Moab <WH4124>; and the children <WH1121> of Ammon <WH5983> shall obey <WH4928> them. them of: Heb. the children of they shall lay: Heb. Edom and Moab shall be the laying on of their hand shall obey: Heb. their obedience

And the LORD <WH3068> shall utterly destroy <WH2763> the tongue <WH3956> of the Egyptian <WH4714> sea <WH3220>; and with his mighty <WH5868> wind <WH7307> shall he shake <WH5130> his hand <WH3027> over the river <WH5104>, and shall smite <WH5221> it in the seven <WH7651> streams <WH5158>, and make men go over <WH1869> dryshod <WH5275>. dryshod: Heb. in shoes

And there shall be an highway <WH4546> for the remnant <WH7605> of his people <WH5971>, which <WH834> shall be left <WH7604>, from Assyria <WH804>; like as it was to Israel <WH3478> in the day <WH3117> that he came up <WH5927> out of the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>.
